Sentencas: The sulfur poisoning behavior of nickel-yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) cermet anodes in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) was investigated under both potentiostatic and galvanostatic conditions.
Titulo: Influence of cell voltage and current on sulfur poisoning behavior of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: While the observed relative drop in cell power output caused by sulfur poisoning decreases as the cell-terminal voltage is lowered potentiostatically (thus more current passing through the cell), it increases as more current is drawn from the cell galvanostatically (thus leading to lower terminal voltage).
Titulo: Influence of cell voltage and current on sulfur poisoning behavior of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The apparent contradictory trends in relative performance loss due to sulfur poisoning are explained using a simple equivalent circuit analysis, which was further validated by impedance measurements of cells before and after poisoning by trace amounts of hydrogen sulfide (H2S) under different conditions.
Titulo: Influence of cell voltage and current on sulfur poisoning behavior of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Results suggest that the relative increase in cell internal resistance caused by sulfur poisoning is smaller when more current is drawn from the cell (or the cell-terminal voltage is lowered) under either potentiostatic or galvanostatic conditions.
Titulo: Influence of cell voltage and current on sulfur poisoning behavior of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Thus, the increase in anode polarization resistance, not the drop in cell power output, should be used to describe the degree of sulfur poisoning in order to avoid any confusion.
Titulo: Influence of cell voltage and current on sulfur poisoning behavior of solid oxide fuel cells
